c74object.name: cage.meta.header
c74object.digest: Header for patches used in meta-scores
c74object.description: Handles the reception of messages in a meta-score scenario, in combination with cage.meta.engine.

inlet.description: A bang in the first inlet will cause the instance number to be output

The second inlet expects the rendered symbolic content, to be received in response to the lllls being output from the render outlet (fourth outlet). Such content must be in the standard gathered syntax (with no header), except that no measure level should be provided (for bach.score).
A lambda inlet is an inlet receiving the answer from a test or modification performed on elements sent out the lambda outlets.
In this case, the answer is some content which should be appropriately collected by the mechanism.
It is important to know that the evaluation chain inside the lambda loop must be direct: you can't use objects such as delay, pipe, defer; nor store the value anywhere waiting for some other event to trigger it. Also see #lambda in the bach Help Center.

outlet.description: The first outlet must be connected to the inlet of thispatcher.
The third outlet sends the messages received by the instance where cage.meta.header is put of lllls coming from the playout of bach.score or bach.roll, for playback purposes.

The fourth outlet sends the messages received by the instance where cage.meta.header is put of lllls coming from the playout of bach.score or bach.roll, for symbolic rendering purposes. The corresponding symbolic rendered portion of score (in gathered syntax, without any measure levels) is expected to be re-injected in cage.meta.header's second (lambda) inlet.

method.name: (remote)
method.description:
To send a message to a specific instance of a loaded patch in a meta-score system, you should use the cage.meta.message symbol as "send" symbol, which must be always followed by the following elements:
- Voice Name (if any, corresponding to some sort of "machine name"), use "default" for voices with no name, or use "all" to send to all voices
- File Name (without extension), use "all" to send to all files
- Instance Number, use "all" to send to all extensions.
- Message, the actual message you need to send. If this message is the open symbol, the corresponding patch is opened.
For instance, ; cage.meta.message default cage.meta.help.patch1 1 open opens the first instance of cage.meta.help.patch1.maxpat, while ; cage.meta.message all all all This is a message to all instances sends a message to all instances.

method.name: bang
method.description: A bang will cause the patch instance number to be output from the second outlet. This number is automatically output at initialization.

c74object.discussion: The cage.meta.header module works in conjunction with cage.meta.engine. This behavior somehow shares some resemblance to the OpenMusic "maquette".
